owl:Ontology.dct:description: The need of a common ontology for describing orthology information in biological research communities has led to the creation of the Orthology Ontology (ORTH). ORTH ontology is designed to describe sequence homology data available in multiple orthology databases on the Web (e.g.: OMA, OrthoDB, HieranoiDB, and etc.). By sequence homology data, we mostly mean gene region, gene and protein-centric orthology, paralogy, and xenology information. Depending on the database, the homology information is structured in different ways. ORTH ontology accommodates these disparate data structures namely Hierarchical Orthologous Group (HOG), cluster of homologous sequences and homologous-pairwise relations between sequences. In addition to the specific ORTH terms, this specification includes terms of the imported ontologies (e.g. Semanticscience Integrated Ontology, SIO) which are pertinent to represent the information from various orthology databases in a homogeneous way.
owl:Ontology.dct:title: Orthology Ontology
owl:Ontology.owl:versionInfo: This ontology is the second version of the orthology ontology first published in 2015 and available at http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/ORTH . @authors T.M. de Farias, H. Chiba, J.T. Fernandez-Breis, E. Antezana, D. Kuznetsov, C. Dessimoz and F. Villiers.

owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:comment: A property to define the database an orthology dataset belongs to.
owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:label: in database

owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:comment: The range of skos:altLabel is the class of RDF plain literals.
skos:prefLabel, skos:altLabel and skos:hiddenLabel are pairwise disjoint properties.
owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:label: alternative label
owl:AnnotationProperty.skos:definition: An alternative lexical label for a resource.
owl:AnnotationProperty.skos:example: Acronyms, abbreviations, spelling variants, and irregular plural/singular forms may be included among the alternative labels for a concept. Mis-spelled terms are normally included as hidden labels (see skos:hiddenLabel).

owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:label: definition
owl:AnnotationProperty.skos:definition: A statement or formal explanation of the meaning of a concept.

owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:label: example
owl:AnnotationProperty.skos:definition: An example of the use of a concept.

owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:label: note
owl:AnnotationProperty.skos:definition: A general note, for any purpose.
owl:AnnotationProperty.skos:scopeNote: This property may be used directly, or as a super-property for more specific note types.

owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:comment: A resource has no more than one value of skos:prefLabel per language tag, and no more than one value of skos:prefLabel without language tag.
The range of skos:prefLabel is the class of RDF plain literals.
skos:prefLabel, skos:altLabel and skos:hiddenLabel are pairwise disjoint properties.
owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:label: preferred label
owl:AnnotationProperty.skos:definition: The preferred lexical label for a resource, in a given language.

owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:label: scope note
owl:AnnotationProperty.skos:definition: A note that helps to clarify the meaning and/or the use of a concept.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: The property links a rooted tree to the specific node that represents the unique root of the tree.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has_Root

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Generic 'has' property.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: This property was simplified. Original range and domain were removed due to be highly abstracted because it is well-know the domain of discourse: orthology databases. The rage restriction of this property is defined as a class restriction in (e.g.: orth:Gene).
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: contained in

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Connects a biological entity to its taxon of origin.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: in taxon

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Is member of is a mereological relation between a item and a collection.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: member of

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A property of a homology relation (e.g.: "inparalogy relation") to state an ancestral evolutionary event. An ancestral evolutionary event is an event that precedes another evolutionary event. For example, a speciation event before a duplication event.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has ancestral evolutionary event

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A property to define the membership of a sequence unit into a co-orthology relation.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has co-orthologous member

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A property of a homology relation (e.g.: "outparalogy relation") to state a descendant evolutionary event. A descendant evolutionary event is an event that occurs after another evolutionary event. For example, a speciation event after a duplication event.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has descendant evolutionary event

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A property of a homology relation (e.g.: "paralogy relation") to state an evolutionary event such as a duplication or a speciation event.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has evolutionary event

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Homologous pairwise relation between sequence units (e.g.: genes, proteins or gene regions). For example, A Gene(A) hasHomolog Gene(B). This property can be materialized or inferred by applying a logical rule.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has homolog

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Property that permits to define the membership of a cluster of homologs or a sequence unit to a clusters of homologs.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has homologous member

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Inverse property of inDataset. It permits to retrieve the clusters or homology relations included in a particular dataset.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has homology data

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A property to define the membership of a in-paralogy relation into co-orthology relation.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has inparalogous member

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Least diverged orthologs (LDOs) are the genes in two different organisms that have diverged the least since their common ancestor and are most likely to retain the greatest functional similarities.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has least diverged ortholog

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Orthologous pairwise relation between genes/proteins. For example, A Gene(A) hasOrtholog Gene(B). This property can be materialized or inferred by applying a logical rule.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has ortholog
is ortholog to

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Paralogous pairwise relation between genes/proteins. For example, a Gene(A) hasParalog Gene(B). This property can be materialized or inferred by applying a logical rule.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has paralog
is paralog to

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Property that associates a cluster of homologs with the taxonomic range at which it has been calculated
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has taxonomic level

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Xenologous pairwise relation between genes/proteins. For example, a Gene(A) hasXenolog Gene(B).
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has xenolog

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Property that provides the dataset associated with a gene tree node
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: in dataset

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Inverse of has homologous member. This property permits to find the cluster in which a cluster or sequence unit is included.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is homologous member

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A sequence unit (e.g.: gene) comes from an organism.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: in organism

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A resource that is replaced by this resource.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: replaces

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: has part is a transitive, reflexive and antisymmetric relation between a whole and itself or a whole and its part.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has part

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A relation between two objects, in which the first object contains information that is used to produce the second object.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: encodes

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A relation between two objects, in which the first object is produced from the information contained in the second object.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is encoded by

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: This property is orignally defined in dcterms schema however in the context of the ORTH ontology we define this property as being an OWL datatype property rather than a generic RDF property. This property should be assigned to any individual that have one or more identifiers. For example, uniprot:P01308 dcterms:identifier "P01308".
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: identifier

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Least diverged orthologs (LDOs) are the genes in two different organisms that have diverged the least since their common ancestor and are most likely to retain the greatest functional similarities. This property assigns a boolean value to state if an orthology relation is a actually LDO relation.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: is least diverged ortholog

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Property that stores the name of the taxonomic level at which a given cluster of homologs has been calculated
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: taxonomic level

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: This property links a cluster of homologs with its taxonomic level.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: taxonomic level identifier

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment:
The version number of a resource. This is a freetext string, typical values are "1.5" or "21". The URI identifying the previous version can be provided using prov:previousVersion.
This property is normally used in a functional way, although PAV does not formally restrict this.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: Version

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: A easy to remember identifier for a UniProtKB entry, but it is not a stable identifier and should not be used by programs to identify entries.
A rememberable string that can be used to find entries, not a stable identifier!
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: Mnemonic

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Tree with a root node, which is the common ancestor to all the nodes in the tree
owl:Class.rdfs:label: RootedTree

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Evolutionary event
owl:Class.rdfs:label: cladogeneticChange

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Evolutionary event that consists on the duplication of a gene
owl:Class.rdfs:label: geneDuplication

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Evolutionary event related with the evolution of a gene in different species
owl:Class.rdfs:label: speciation

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Basic unit of graphs and trees. This class was modified from its original definition (with class restrictions) to avoid multiple statements that relates a Node to a Network (e.g.: RootedTree). In its orignal definition, for each created instance of a Node, an additional statement must be defined to declare that a given node belongs to a Network what is quite verbose. However, we know that sub-nodes of a root node must belong to the same given Rooted Tree (e.g.: HOGs). Therefore, no needs to state sub-nodes to be part of a RootedTree.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Node

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A living thing, such as an animal, a plant, a bacterium, or a fungus., Any individual living (or previously living) being. EXAMPLE(S): animal, human being.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Organism

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A sequence of amino acids linked by peptide bonds which may lack appreciable tertiary structure and may not be liable to irreversible denaturation.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: polypeptide

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A region (or regions) that includes all of the sequence elements necessary to encode a functional transcript. A gene may include regulatory regions, transcribed regions and/or other functional sequence regions.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: gene

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A manufactured term used to allow the parts of a gene to have an is_a path to the root.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: gene_member_region

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A collection of related genes.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: gene_group

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Co-orthology is a relation defined over three genes, where two of them are inparalogs with respect to the speciation event associated to the third gene. The two inparalogous genes are said to be co-orthologous to the third (out-group) gene.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: co-orthology relation

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A region (or regions) that includes all of the sequence elements necessary to encode a functional transcript. A gene may include regulatory regions, transcribed regions and/or other functional sequence regions.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Gene

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A node of a tree whose leaf nodes are sequence units and whose internal nodes are clusters of homologs
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Gene tree node

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A tree whose content is the result of the application of hierarchical clustering to a dataset
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Hierarchical clustering tree

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A tree whose leaf nodes correspond to sequence units (e.g.: genes).
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Hierarchical gene tree

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Set of homologous sequences
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Cluster of homologous sequences

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This class represents homology relations among sequence units (e.g genes, proteins or gene regions).
owl:Class.rdfs:label: homology relation

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Inparalogy is a relation defined over a triplet. It involves a pair of genes and a speciation event of reference. A gene pair is an inparalog if they are paralogs and duplicated after the speciation event of reference.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: inparalogy relation

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Least diverged orthologs (LDOs) are the genes in two different organisms that have diverged the least since their common ancestor and are most likely to retain the greatest functional similarities. This is a symmetric relation.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: least diverged orthology relation

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A living being, such as an animal, a plant, a bacterium, or a fungus., Any individual living (or previously living) being. Example: animal, human being. An organim is associated to a taxon such as "Homo Sapiens", NCBI taxonomy identifier: 9606.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Organism

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Set of homologous sequences derived from a speciation event.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Cluster of orthologs

owl:Class.rdfs:comment:
Dataset that provides orthology relations including clusters of orthologs, pairwise orthology relations, and so on.
Examples would be the content of resources such as OMA, InParanoid, TreeFam, PhylomeDB and so on. Each release of the resources is different dataset.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Orthology datasource

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: homology pairwise relation that involves sequences that diverged after a speciation event.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: orthology relation

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Outparalogy is also a relation defined over a pair of genes and a speciation event of reference. This pair are outparalogs if the duplication event through which they are related to each other predates the speciation event of reference.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: outparalogy relation

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Set of homologous sequences derived from a duplication event
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Cluster of paralogs

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Homology relation that involves sequences that diverged after a duplication event.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: paralogy relation

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A sequence of amino acids linked by peptide bonds which may lack appreciable tertiary structure and may not be liable to irreversible denaturation.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Protein

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: protein or DNA sequence as a unit of comparison
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Sequence unit

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A region of the sequence of the gene.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: gene region
region of a gene
subgene

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The taxonomic level represents the taxon at which a group of sequences are considered members of the same cluster of orthologs/paralogs
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Taxonomic level

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Gene pairs whose history, since their divergence, includes a horizontal transfer.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: xenology relation

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An element of a taxonomy for classifying life forms.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Taxon

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A database is a data store such as relational, hierarchical and graph databases.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: database
